poem:
Title: "In the Fold of Pages, Lies a War"

In every book, a battlefield unfolds,
Ink-blotted pages echo tear-stained faces.
Swords of words clash in sentences bold,
Each page turn, a trace of blood-stained traces.
Same earth, different tales, ages old,
War and peace, entangled like laces.
Scribbled lines of sorrow unsold,
In paper valleys, find their resting places.
